image.altText: a woman and man on a boat, with choppy blue waves below, and bright blue sky above. They are wearing lifejackets and look happy.

props.synopsis: Sharleen Lloyd's home in South Australia's Riverland became an island only accessible by boat during one of the state's biggest floods. But when the SA government's daily flow data lost meaning, she questioned everything.

title.children: Shortly before floods made Sharleen's home an island, she lost all faith in flow data

image.altText: Emergency workers at a house damaged by a van.

props.synopsis: Two people and a pet dog are lucky to have avoided serious injury, police said, after a van that left the road and "became airborne" smashed through the front window of a house at Nairne in the Adelaide Hills on Saturday night.

title.children: Van that 'became airborne' narrowly misses two people in lounge

image.altText: A dead stingray on the shore with blue tarp over it.

props.synopsis: A distressed beachgoer says he was shocked to find a mutiliated stingray carcass. The state's fishing regulator says it receives reports of a similar nature regularly.

title.children: Mutilated stingray carcasses on Adelaide beaches spark plea for humane handling of fish

image.altText: A sign on a fence in front of a snow-covered house says 'Trump Make America Great Again'

props.synopsis: This week's Iowa caucuses signal the start of the primary race for the 2024 US election. Donald Trump's the strongest polling Republican, but many caucus-goers say there are better options.

title.children: 'So many Trump haters': As a small state holds first big US vote, some Republicans are turning

image.altText: A group of people waving flags

props.synopsis: Beijing despises the winner of Taiwan's election, Lai Ching-tei, calling him a separatist and a troublemaker. But it can't ignore the message voters are sending with his victory, writes Kathleen Calderwood.

title.children: Taiwan just had an election. The outcome sends a big message to China

image.altText: Adam Walton

props.synopsis: The Australian Open has arrived with four Aussies in action and Novak Djokovic kicking off the night session on day one at Melbourne Park. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie wildcard drops first two sets on day one of the Australian Open

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Aussie Adam Walton is two sets down in his first-round clash
We have our first winner of the tournament
Australian Adam Walton drops the first set in a tie-break

image.altText: A bearded man with a cap sits with his blonde son, who is wearing a beanie. Both are smiling.

props.synopsis: When Nick Wilson "couldn't breathe properly" leaving a games arcade, he knew he was in trouble. Little did he know his son Harry would become a "hero".

title.children: 7yo uses life-saving lessons given by paramedics to help his dad

image.altText: A snake dangles from an ice dispenser on a fridge door.

props.synopsis: When she went to turn off the radio in her outdoor entertainment area, Adelaide Hills resident Gail Auricht thought the hissing sound she could hear was an air compressor — then she spotted a red-bellied black snake caught in her fridge.

title.children: 'Enough to send a chill down anyone's spine': Snake found dangling down from ice dispenser on fridge door

image.altText: Illegal tobacco trade may be fuelling terrorism, Border Force warns

props.synopsis: As another tobacco shop burns in Melbourne, the federal government announces a $188 million crackdown on the tobacco black market, hoping to stop imports before they reach the Australian border.

title.children: Government launches illegal tobacco crackdown, as bikie 'turf war' on tobacco shops rages on

image.altText: Left to right: Ben Shelton, Jannik Sinner, Novak Djokovic, Carlos Alcaraz and Sebastian Korda.

props.synopsis: Father time comes for everyone. Except it seems for Novak Djokovic but even the Serbian great can't stave off generation after generation forever and now could be their time to do the seemingly impossible.

title.children: Novak Djokovic is tennis's alpha male but he is being hunted by a generation who don't fear him

image.altText: Sam Kerr

props.synopsis: Matildas star Samantha Kerr posts a photo from hospital asking for Netflix recommendations, after going under the knife to fix her torn ACL.

title.children: Sam Kerr posts upbeat photo from hospital after undergoing surgery to fix her ACL

image.altText: A woman with dyed red hair and glasses in a tie and suit vest and a woman with blonde hair and a green sweater

props.synopsis: The Pope's recent pronouncement against surrogacy has sparked heated global debate about the controversial issue. In Australia, surrogacy is complex: deplored by some but embraced by others whose lives have been transformed by remarkable acts of generosity and love.

title.children: Alice and Olivia were both conceived via surrogacy. Today, they have contrasting views on the controversial practice

image.altText: A large, dark and ominous cloud hangs over the Darwin skyline

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology issues a severe weather warning for residents across the coastal Top End and Tiwi Islands, urging them to brace for potentially damaging winds and rainfall totals of up to 160mm in just six hours.

title.children: Top End residents on alert for 90kph winds and flash flooding as tropical monsoon ramps up

image.altText: A man kneels on a lawn next to a large piece of metal.

props.synopsis: Fireworks at a suspicious blaze at a tobacco shop in Melbourne's north explode towards firefighters and send shrapnel into surrounding homes.

title.children: Suspicious fire at tobacco shop sent debris flying into homes, residents of Melbourne's north say

image.altText: Close up of the front of an Adelaide train at the platform

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old man will appear in the Christies Beach Magistrates court on Monday charged over an alleged sexual assault on a train in Adelaide this week.

title.children: Man charged with rape over alleged sexual assault on Adelaide train

image.altText: A bald man wearing a dark collared shirt smiles, with gravestones and red dirt behind him

props.synopsis: Paul Kaesler isn't sure how many people are buried in the cemetery on his rural property, but experts say it's likely he is not the only one with graves in his backyard.

title.children: Paul's family is buried in a backyard cemetery shrouded in mystery. One day, he plans to join them there

image.altText: The men in yellow firefighting uniforms and helmets stand in front of a white fire truck.

props.synopsis: With just half a dozen active members, the future once looked grim for Port Wakefield's volunteer firefighting station. But 18 months later, the number of firefighters has more than doubled.

title.children: Filipino firies step up to save a country fire station after community's desperate plea for volunteers

image.altText: A man and a young girl wearing overalls sit on a rocky outcrop overlooking the ocean. The sky is clear and blue.

props.synopsis: As the town of Elliston processes another shark attack, the region's mayor calls on the South Australian government to "terminate" sharks involved in fatal incidents. But one expert says such measures will not prevent future attacks.

title.children: Regional South Australian mayor calls for 'targeted approach' to shark attacks

image.altText: A close-up of a copper diving helmet with the window open as two men help tighten screws on the chest plate.

props.synopsis: Entering the sea strapped to more than 80 kilograms of weights, metal and canvas dating back to the early 1900s may not sound like fun for most, but for this group of divers, it's the best way to spend a weekend.

title.children: It's a lot different from scuba diving but this 'amazing' vintage technology is being kept alive

image.altText: Boeing ANA

props.synopsis: A domestic flight of Japan's All Nippon Airways returns to its departure airport after a crack was found on the cockpit window of the Boeing 737-800 aircraft.

title.children: Boeing aircraft turns back after crack found in cockpit window

image.altText: Dad whale on a beach.

props.synopsis: The death of a suspected fin whale has provided the Australian Museum with what could be only the third set of tissue samples gathered from the species in almost 200 years.

title.children: Beached whale provides 'really rare opportunity' for research into elusive fin species

image.altText: three men with chainsaws standing on top of a tree that has been cut up. A child stands next to them

props.synopsis: A self-confessed "rag tag" bunch of volunteers have formed a group known locally as the Chainsaw Champions to cut through the aftermath of the tornado that tore through parts of south-east Queensland.

title.children: Chainsaw Champions channel volunteer spirit in Gold Coast Christmas Day tornado recovery relief

image.altText: An image shows two women pointing at a map of Australia next to images of postage stamps.

props.synopsis: In the smartphone era, many people have a podcast in their ears, their friends at their fingertips, and information up to their eyeballs. So when it comes to receiving news, a handwritten letter from a friend might seem old-fashioned.

title.children: Off-grid postal services are helping people rewrite the way they communicate

image.altText: A slightly smiling Indigenous man stands in front of red rocks, looks down on camera, green trees, black t-shirt, black cap.

props.synopsis: In Alice Springs, addiction has a stranglehold. But a group of local Aboriginal men are hoping to break cycles, one conversation at a time.

title.children: Little-used addiction recovery program quadruples in popularity after on-country healing

image.altText: A collection of stars surrounded by a smoky white and red nebula

props.synopsis: Broken Hill's wettest January day on record leaves a clear view of the cosmos in its wake, exciting tourists and locals keen to catch a glimpse.

title.children: Record-breaking rainfall in outback NSW creates 'sparkling' conditions for stargazing

image.altText: People on the sand and water with life savers under an umbrella on Mackenzies Bay beach

props.synopsis: The mysterious appearance and disappearance of sand at a bay in Sydney's east has caused both intrigue and headaches for decades, depending on who you are.

title.children: 'Not for the faint-hearted': People told to stay away from mysterious Sydney beach

image.altText: A Palestinian woman walks near the rubble of a house destroyed in an Israeli strike.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Palestinian Australians are waiting for family members with approved visas to get a green light from border officials to leave Gaza.

title.children: Palestinian Australians say their families can't leave Gaza despite having a valid Australian visa

image.altText: A couple in evening wear

props.synopsis: When Crown Prince Frederik and his Australian-born wife Princess Mary ascend the throne overnight, it will be a simple, pared-back affair. But it's all part of a centuries-long effort to keep the Danish monarchy going.

title.children: The key to the Danish monarchy's survival is 'informality'. Here's how Mary became their secret weapon

image.altText: An alive elderly woman smiles as she lies in her handmade wooden coffin

props.synopsis: Books, boxes and knick-knacks might be stored in your spare room, but in Mary Flynn's home studio is a wooden coffin, which she made herself. She's never been frightened of death and wants to spark conversations about natural burials.

title.children: Mary has made her own biodegradable coffin — and knows exactly where she would like to be buried

image.altText: A family of four standing outside their electric 4WD and camper

props.synopsis: "Green power couple" Tim and Renae McLennan want to be one of the first to travel around Australia using an electric vehicle to tow a pop-up caravan.

title.children: How this Perth family plans to make the great Australian road trip better for the planet

image.altText: A landscape shot of men, women and children sifting through dirt

props.synopsis: Hollywood depicts it as miners brandishing rifles and bulldozers clashing amid exploding outhouses, but locals say that version has taken poetic licence. Here's what really happened during the 1970s, when interest in Australia's gems exploded.

title.children: How 'the wildest race for riches since the gold rush' really unfolded in the 1970s

image.altText: Maldivian resort

props.synopsis: The Maldives stands to lose hundreds of millions of dollars as its giant neighbour threatens to halt its tourism there. But why is the world's most populous country flexing its muscles in that way, and what's China got to do with it?

title.children: Why is India turning the screws on a tiny island neighbour?

image.altText: Eli, left, looks to Lyle as they walk by the side of their house, Lyle with an arm around Eli and another holding an esky.

props.synopsis: Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe is an extremely Darra story but that's not where much of the Netflix adaptation was filmed. In fact, a lot of it was shot outside of Brisbane.

title.children: From Darra to The Gap: How Netflix recreated 1980s Brisbane in Boy Swallows Universe
